review: its a great game the only thing is that it is a sequel so play red matter 1 first and it is very much an atmospheric horror game there are no jumpscares but it is spooky at times
fantastic narrative puzzle game that performs great with my vr headset
its just too slow for me if you like nothing but puzzles buy it now

good continuation of interesting puzzle solving story this time with action shooter elements plot is predictable but good enough graphics is decent but for good quality you will need to use supersampling puzzles are like in previous part well balanced and you can solve them by yourself if you are patient and know how to follow instructions if you like good vr games  definitely try this one
slava comrade

an awesome sequel to a great game there is a little weapon use but the developers kindly provided a difficulty setting for players like me who are not actionplatform players more kudos the game is astonishingly well polished for such a small dev team worked perfectly on my hp reverb g2 after switching to steamvr

if you enjoyed the first one youd enjoy this one as well they added onto the game play a little bit main character now has a voice puzzles are the right amount of difficulty graphics are pretty good its not game of the year but for the price id say its worth it on a sale you can get through it in a weekend took me about 67 hours

this is in my opinion one of the best adventureescape game type vr title i really enjoyed the narrative and the look and feel from the soviet cold war era you dont get very complicated puzzles its a matter of moving parts to the right place to do an action most of the time i finished the game in 10 hours and its been a really nice experience i would highly recommend it ive played on a quest 3 linked to steam no bug or glitches whatsoever

a very good implementation of vr with a quest 3 headset and an average pc it runs very well and the graphics  immersion is excellent a great demonstration of what vr can really achieve amazing planetary surfaces and space station environments good mechanics as well enjoyable puzzles but not too hard brillliant
better than the first one
great beautiful materials detailed world top notch interactions simple puzzles good voiceacting great immersion
continuing the story and with more puzzles with a bit of shooting

if there is any good judging scheme for a game it is that i completed this game pretty much in one massive session of the holidays  my back was killing me from standing in vr for so long i was hungry tired emotional but i just couldnt stop if you liked alyx half life still my favourite game of all time then i think you will like this one too

great fun solving puzzles obviously inspired by hlalyx its probably top 5 vr games in terms of fidelity and quality from my experience story is interesting puzzles are challenging environments are detailed and immersive great game i am glad i came back to it after getting stuck for an inordinate amount of time behind some turrets then quickly solving that part and getting back to it and progressing the story in an interesting way
good story pace is slow especially at first but eventually it gets goodfun with some light action and worth buying when on sale if alyx was a 1010 then redmatter2 is a  710
great play red matter 1 first it is just as good
great story game i suck at puzzles
one of the best vr games cannot believe that such a complex game was made by such a small team it was awesome time
a great vr experience the puzzles werent overly challenging and it was just plain fun
improves on the first and makes cool use of vr in some places  still a bit short for the price
great game for under 30   matches and improves from the original really like the graphics and tie in also the shooting is different but fun  so far so good
7510 kinda slow good graphics music gets a bit repetitive mostly a walkingfloating simulator and platformer with puzzles and some infrequent simple combat
must try the best
thoroughly enjoyed the story the puzzle the combat the atmospherevoice acting was excellent great sequel to rm brilliant game well done vertical robot
great vr adventure like the first one would have loved more exploration and harder puzzles but whats there doesnt disappoint

honestly amazing game i recommend trying to beat it without walk throughs the story is great and graphics are stunning great job devs spoiler only part i wasnt a fan of was parts involving the the defense droids
yes
very immersive and underrated loved the interaction and the environments still holds up very well visually and has an interesting story

i havent finished it yet but im on the last bit  this game is great just an improvement over the first part however as some others have mentioned the gun controls are very weak unnecessary too just dodging the cams wouldve been more fun i think  puzzles are still much too easy slightly more challenging than in part 1 but definitely still way too easy
good story good puzzles goo controls minimal hand holding excellent game

excellent vr scifi game worked well with my hp reverb g2 i played the first one then purchased the second havent been disappointed with improved overall quality and game duration graphics environments and gameplay is very good puzzles are well balanced with increasing difficulty i definitely recommend this game
the best vr game ive ever played
one of the most beautiful vr games ever made  great story too
really enjoyed the game nice story and levels even if a bit short great atmosphere

for anyone who likes a slow paced scifi adventure with some pretty cool puzzles id very much recommend this beautifull looking game there is even some shooting action this time which i personally liked very much

i would recommend however the puzzles are not up to par  in general the game and experience is good it lacked for me a little of the ghost experience of the 1st game but more than made up for it with more game play in the 2nd  the issue i had friction with was simply the puzzles were far too easy and there was a bit of padding in there that made the game longer

its a really solid game it feels good to play a full and finished video game with a decent story an interesting gameplay i just find it sad that so few people bothered to even play the tutorial i found it was a great experience and i very much enjoyed 100ing it in the 8 hours i spent in it it also doesnt require a psn account which is nice to see

game starts directly where urlhttpsstoresteampoweredcomapp966680redmatterred matterurl ended they added some shooting sequences here what is imho a great addition and a nice breakup from the puzzle solving rm 2 is in every aspect a step forward be it the puzzles the environments or the story length also increased to around 55h
i love the soundtrack and visuals
710  good more polished then red matter 1 but storywise its bout the same or less not so satisfying ending 6 hrs game play time blind easy enough puzzles not so great combat

excellent story and atmosphere  i especially liked that your character speaks now and his frequent banter with beta very fun gameplay and puzzles for a vr game very nice graphics only part i liked less are the combat sequences but here is not too much of those
good game
perfection
i didnt find this game as creepy as the first but still plenty of interesting environments and puzzles not sure how i feel about the gunplay though
masterpiece at alyx levels graphically and also the gameplay loops they did an amazing job and anyone with a vr headset should experience this game
in my top list of  vr games good graphics controls and not to hard puzzles good storyquest 3 works great has an ingame resolution slider that goes up to 20
one of the most visually stunning games in all of vr
best graphics ive seen on hp g2 lots of fun loved the first one keen to see what this dev team makes next whatever it is

not finished with it yet but having a great time with this game even better than the first one great puzzles that make sense in the context of the situation the couple times so far that i had trouble was because i wasnt as observant of my surroundings as i should be a couple other times i thought i had more to do in the room because i accomplished the task quicklyso spent some unnecessary time looking for nothing i would highly recommend this game after playing the first one of course

a solid adventure its a bit more story and puzzle oriented than action though there is action in parts and it never felt dull or boring to me things move along nicely the puzzles are generally basic but they did stump me 4 or 5 times until i found the solution a couple puzzles are pretty excellent id say its worth playing especially for adventure lovers i took 95 hours

ive enjoyed this almost as much as alyx the graphics are definitely very enjoyable high quality all the way the game is long and has beautiful sights and diverse scenarios however the puzzles make no sense at all the notes lying around all over the place narrating the storyline pointing you to the solutions of the puzzles there is so much implausibility all over the place but considering all the pros this is forgiven i definitely enjoyed this game

read a magazineblog review on this game i finally bought it on sale and its really cool it reminds me of the not scary parts of half life alyx  where you are just walking around amazed and doing the puzzles so in that sense it is  refreshing not to be in constant terror and anxiety for a change just good ole scifi  fun now i have to finish it and try the first red matter  and wish i had the quest 3 to play them on still amazing on the quest 2 though
good
spaniards making a game about cosmonauts amazing
pretty much peak vr puzzle game a musthave for anyone even remotely into this genre   excellent atmosphere varied puzzles story play time nice soundtracks   unplayable on linux
beautiful game but short really short 7 hours and you can probably get all achievements puzzles are challenging sometimes in a good way

i found the toilet on the saturn base i opened the lid and used the jetpackteleport feature to see if i could teleport into the toilet it was mostly red indicating cant go there but there was one spot that was blue indicating i could go there so i went there  and then the whole view turned black and little blue message appeared that said i was out of bounds and told me to crouch but nothing i did worked so i had to quit

glorified walking simulator and i mean that with love  theres some very very cool things to experience here  i fear that some people will give up on a difficult puzzle and not experience the whole game  either look around for clues or just look up a guide if thats your thing  at just over 5 hours normally id wish there were more to the game considering the price but in this case it was worth it for me

i was reading some people were comparing this game to alyx in terms of vr masterpiece well i have to say that also for me this reaches a crazy level of immersion similar to alyx not only the design and graphics is great but the interactions and rhythm between action exploration and puzzles is just great everything is perfectly detailed with the same old mix of cartoonish feeling that the first game had  definitely recommended and surely one of my top 5 or top 3 vr games so far
great game lots of fun a puzzle driven vr experience highly recommend dont need the first one but it would help to understand the story a bit
better than the first one
absolutely fantastic game not extremely difficult and i loved every minute of it
really enjoyed the game looking at the sale now  well worth the money i enjoyed the first as well  so if you havent played the first get them both
a good game with interesting puzzles and great atmosphere of futuristic exussr
good game very good visuals but there is way too much bloom you can barely see anything under desk lamps

better than the first one even though theres a bit of shooting now and then some nice puzzle ideas even though most times its find partparts to progress graphics are nice and the overall experience is rather polished  tip if you find walkingspeedjetpack flying movement too slow switch to teleport in the options reduces immersion though
looks great
i almost like the first one better since it doesnt have combat but the second installment ist graphically much better and has really nice puzzles
yes i loved how the puzzles are harder made me use more than what my brain offered
a few really drop dead moments  vr at its finest
the most beautiful vr ive ever played period
an absolutely amazing game it looks and feels really nice and has the world interactivity to compete with halflife alyx this game was amazing start to finish and i honestly wish there was more of it

escape room for about six hours it seamlessly follows on from the first part and is less spooky but the resulting feeling is perhaps more pleasant nice locations interesting music good puzzles lysenkos are the best i really enjoyed it with the exception of the final drone fight why do they have to run and gun in every game

played it primarily on psvr2 easily one of the best looking vr games out there it was very impressive for a small team for me the story wasnt very interesting but the rest of the game was great the combat was maybe a bit weak but personally im already bored of shooters in vr so this being more explorationoriented is a plus

an absolute treat for vr both visually and gameplay wise sure its no half life alyx in terms of gameplay but the visuals are certainly up there if not a notch higher the story is very interesting and picks up right where the first part had left off heres the moment you should start playing rm1 before considering playing rm2 d and nicely closes up the story  highly recommended for anyone interested in story based vr games d

one of the best vr experience ive had so far good story beautiful graphics welloptimized graphic engine good mixture of puzzles exploration storytelling and action i also had a lot of fun using the jetpack it does induce a bit of nausea but much less than i would have expected i absolutely recommend this game
great game still would say play the first one even if somewhat dated controls
awesome adventure much better than red matter 1
great vr game improved in every way in comparison with red matter 1 cool story great setup and locations pretty graphics a must have vr experience
different but solvable puzzles
very good graphics puzzles may be hard for some but ultimately rewarding also there are no jump scares in this game only the spooky ambiance of the music and surroundings

as many have said it is an improvement on the first graphically is stunning with a lot of wow moment for design and sheer size of certain locations i find the puzzle a bit more streamlined however i am not a huge fan of very complex puzzle mostly due of time constraint when playing games the story is also easier to follow in my opinion   a must have for any vr user out there it works flawlessly with the quest 2 in airlink without any issue  we now need red matter 3

great game looks fantastic and runs really smooth liked all the puzzles the combat is a good variation to the puzzling part yes it could be handled better but as it is not often the case it feels good the last battle was a bit tedious  information for easily scared people like me there are no jumpscares although it is one hell of an atmosphere though great job achieving that  playtime 5 hours   get it its worth it
the story gameplay voice acting and environmental design are all top notch  definitely one of my top 10 favorite vr titles

hands down one of the best vr games ive played great story excellent graphics and super smooth performance even on my gtx 1070 great job guys my only regret was not getting this game months ago hope for more vr games from your team im sold
worth the playthrough for the outer areas they blew my mind
short but sweet great for people who dont have the best vr legs
best in class visuals big advances in gameplay over the original solid vr centric puzzles  great immersive experience
superb game everything the first had but better and more  absolutely worth getting  worst thing i can say is that the combat just feels a bit out of place
i dont know what youre all complaining about the gun is the best part i hate the force pull thing it doesnt work well
vr library must have game  amazing
space
superimmersive stopped playing a few times just to look at the view

one of the games that make you happy that you got a vr headset a very delightful escape room style premise with some gun fighting mechanics some puzzles will make you stop and think but arent frustratingly difficult up there as one of the best vr games that i have played

dont sleep on this game  its phenomenal  the graphics are incredible  it looks and feels aaa  the puzzles are tricky but not frustrating  i wanted to know how the story ended and was left feeling very satisfied at the end its kinda like half life alex younger sibling in terms of graphics and depth and immersion  i really loved it  so much more than the og red matter  my only complaint is that i wish it was longer but i got a good 78hrs out of it
